children.subject:
EE 142 (Integrated Circuits for Communications)? It's really the only comms class here I can think of. But there are a lot of pre-reqs (140, 120, 105, 16AB), so it might be awhile before you should take it depending on what year you are. Wireless is quite high level stuff that draws from a lot of fundamental classes.

EE122: Introduction to communication networks.
EE123: Digital signal processing.
EE117: Electromagnetic fields and waves -- more for antenna design related stuff.

I think all these classes together would form a good understanding of wireless communications for an undergraduate. Wireless is one of those fields where you kinda need a PhD to really get into, in my opinion. Almost all positions for jobs and internships in wireless require a PhD, from my experience.

history.subject: Any class recommendations to understand the fundamental concepts behind 4G/5G wireless networks?
